revised_title: Microscopic Changes in the Nervous System in Chronic Dourine and Comparison with Sleeping Sickness
tldr: The author examines the microscopic changes in the nervous system of a horse with chronic dourine, a trypanosome infection, and compares it to the changes found in sleeping sickness. The study reveals a marked proliferation of neuroglia tissue, chronic interstitial inflammation, and lymphocyte infiltration, suggesting similarities between the two diseases.
